bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Financial Institutions Act;
primary jurisdiction has the same meaning as in section 157 of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person that holds a business authorization, or that is deemed under section 191 of the Act to have a business authorization, authorizing the person to carry on an insurance business must be a member of the OmbudService for Life & Health Insurance or the General Insurance OmbudService.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person's business is restricted to reinsurance,
the person is a mutual company, or

the person is a member of an organization with purposes similar to the purposes of the organizations referred to in subsection (1), in fulfillment of a requirement under a law of the insurer's primary jurisdiction.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemption from section 80.3 of the Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: Section 80.3 of the Act does not apply to an insurer whose business is restricted to reinsurance.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Financial Institutions Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 141, sections 80.3 and 289]
